Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant qualifies as a Convention refugee based on a well-founded fear of persecution
Application_Facts: The applicant's arrests were part of generalized law enforcement, not targeted persecution
Decision_Outcome: Application for refugee status is denied
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Refugee Division's decision
Court_Ruling: The court upheld the Board's finding that the applicant did not meet the legal threshold for persecution
Legal_Standard: Systematic and persistent acts required to constitute persecution
Assessment_Factor: Lack of systematic and persistent persecution
Applicable_Legislation: Convention relating to the Status of Refugees
Review_Standard: Whether the Board's findings were perverse or capricious
Evidence_Used: Details of past arrests in Sri Lanka
Application_Basis: Well-founded fear of persecution due to perceived political opinion or association
Governing_Rule: Persecution requires systematic and persistent conduct, not isolated incidents
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of evidence showing systematic and persistent targeting
Harm_Assessment: No sufficient risk of future harm established
Cause_Description: Applicant claims past arrests indicate a well-founded fear of persecution due to perceived LTTE links
Evidence_Handling: Board analyzed arrest records and context; court found no error
Evidence_Issues: Isolated incidents not rising to level of persecution
Decision_Rationale: Arrests were part of general law enforcement, not targeted persecution
Decision_Making_Body: Refugee Appeal Division / Refugee Protection Division
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence of targeted, systematic persecution
Legal_Standard_Applied: Well-founded fear of persecution based on Convention grounds
